what's-his-face that's my recommendation
anyway counselor
don't do it directed by Ridley Scott
from a script by Cormac McCarthy the
counselor is about a lawyer who gets
involved with drug traffickers in her
review Manohla Dargis writes mr. Scott
manages all his swiftly spinning parts
with impeccable control and a loose and
visual styling the beauty of the
landscapes is about all that feels
coherent in an often unrecognizable
unsettling world
mr. Scott seriousness isn't always well
served by the scripts he films but in
mr. McCarthy he is found a partner whose
convictions make no room for canned
formula in fleshing just rattling a cage
what a world you think the world is
strange I meant yours telling mush when
she did i am jimmyy hoppa
and every minute
in Quincy directed by Jehan dojin
the square is a documentary about the
Egyptian revolution from the winter of
2011 to the summer of 2013 in his review
Mayo Scott writes even though the square
depicts widely covered recent events it
still feels like a revelation this is
partly because of the immediacy of misma
James approach which often puts the
viewer in the midst of chaos as it
unfolds this fearless exercise in
political reportage is also a formidable
if necessarily wrong work of political
thought while it records the gruesome
collision of utopian aspirations with
cold political realities it is not a
depressing film it suggests the Egyptian
revolution after a glorious birth and a
blighted infancy is still at square
- salut gracias and thoughtful
photography digital restaurant addiction
caper many do we relate to change in our
own families this one on usage is such a
massive scale
directed by Abdul Latif Casita blue is
the warmest color is a love story about
a young woman's passage from curiosity
to heartbreak in his review a Oh Scott
writes trying to push the boundaries of
empathy to communicate physical rapture
by visual means mr. kiss each a bumps
into the limits of the medium and lapses
into voyeurism turning erotic sensation
into a spectacle of flesh the film is at
times as sloppy as a Tarawa with a runny
nose and unruly hair but it is never
dull lazy or predictable it is dizzy
obsessive inspired and relentless many
more words can and will be spent on blue
is the warmest color but for now I'll
settle for just one
glorious
